title: I'll tell you why Wukong is getting nerfed  again and why Yasusu is getting a major Buff
body:
Because of the Wukong mid pick vs susu couple of weeks ago
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X06ySPQuv-c
Riot's balance team didn't like the fact that {{champion:62}} started seeing proplay and winning the matchup.

So in order to balance things,  Wu nerfs hit, but that's not enough, gotta hit him with more nerfs, not to forget about the runes nerfs will affect him as well, but while doing so, they're buffing their favorite flashy champs which they worked "so hard on over the years".

From their point of view, a 4-5% pick ratio on 51-52% win ratio is unhealthy, gotta nerf
but for 22+% pick ratio on 49% is underperforming, gotta buff so they go above 51% w.r on that kind of pick/ban ratio.

I have a feeling Q > R > Q will be enough to 1shot any squishy for both {{champion:64}} and {{champion:157}} next patch

Go on, ship those buffs/nerfs, I want people to have no reason to play this champ so he can finally get his rework.

replies.body:
It's sad because it's true. Every time an unpopular champion which does not sell a lot of skins gets picked, they literally get instanerfed. Wukong is in many ways a neglected champion, and his mains have been asking for some skill expression in his dated kit for ages, but Riot would rather nerf him into the gutter just because someone else than his one-tricks is playing him. 


What we learn from this is that Riot is a complete **PIECE OF SHIT** company. The balance team watches a few LCS matches and decides from there which champions are getting buffed and which are getting shafted. Be prepared for nerfs if your main champion gets picked at LCS and said champion does not fit into the balance team's misguided image of the ideal meta. They're trying so hard to balance this game around LCS yet pro play is more **GARBAGE** than ever. Meanwhile solo queue is borderline unplayable. 

**I sincerely hope y'all have stopped buying skins and supporting Riot financially.
**

Wrong. Wukong's supposed to be a diver and yet if he gets fed he outclasses basically every single assassin because he has a burst that's untelegraphed and undelayed save for maybe his ultimate depending where everyone is situated when he uses it. Yasuo's core ability is pretty much a short-range skill shot that he has to cast successfully two times to unleash a bad-ass tornado which depending on the comp someone's with could be his only way to initiate his ultimate.   Get fed with Wukong, dive enemy and instantly burst them down. I can't imagine a player can't afford to be that mindless as a fed Yasuo. They gotta actually land things, they have one of his lifelines being a single cast ability with a long cooldown, and his ultimate while being super lame with the right comp is also never guaranteed with the wrong comp. Having to land three skill shots to get an ultimate.

Point being, I can play around against a fed Yasuo. Wukong
? Probs not.
